g.text: The verify function uses mathematical eliptical curve functions
to verify whether the message matches the signature and from address.
use the public key, signature and message(the transaction)
and verify if the message is true by checking the database.
takes in a public key from the keys or user and records it into
the database and sets the balance property to zero.
The keys function generates a private and
public key which can be used by the server
The transaction function takes in a stuct named trx which has the propeties:
of from, to amount, signature, message and previus trx id hashed using sha512.
which after data validation it triggers the Verify function with the msg, signature and from.
Purchase of the token like a stock or ipo as a currency like the USD
Use of the currency for payements of general use with support pool
The block function adds the current trx to the index local database
which is public but hashed meaning its verifiable but not public and traceable.
The database is locally hosted and distributed via an API.
While the data in the database in private the code is public and
so verifiable to check if the code is safe and private.
sig: an elliptic curve based signature.
prevBlockHash: the previous block's id hashed
bal: a float with the users balance
The exchange will be made using NextJS and will be using tailwind css for the Style sheets.
